chunks.chunk_text: Hello, this is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I'm Phil and I'm Georgie.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: Yes, in this programme we'll be hearing about the Bamboo School, a unique school where the children
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: call the shots. They have the power to make the decisions. We'll also be learning some useful new vocabulary. And before you ask, Phil, yes, the Bamboo School really is made of bamboo.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: I guess they have to learn English. OK, Georgie, I'll reveal the answer at the end of the programme.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: I am interested in accounting to begin with, so I get excited by it.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: I actually get to do it. I enjoy it a lot since we are doing the actual job. With this hands-on experience we see the school's real spending and the things we purchased. So you went to a local school before, just in this area. What are the differences between that school and this school? My old school wasn't like this. It was just classes and then home. Here I get to try so many things, gain real-world experience and work on my leadership skills
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: with my friends. I never had these opportunities before and the school has been amazing.Noonim says shopping at the market is a hands-on experience. She's actively involved in doing something practical rather than getting someone else to do it.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: Of course, there are some adults. Every school needs teachers. But what's special is how children are trusted and respond positively to that trust. Here's reporter William Kramer, again, speaking with Mayra Anoubi for BBC World Service programme People Fixing the World.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: Just to be clear, it seems like the grown-ups are still in charge in the classrooms, but outside it's the kids who run stuff. Yeah, I think that's broadly right. And I think one of the things that's interesting about this school is it manages to be quite conventional in some ways and really innovative, even radical in others. At the bamboo school, the grown-ups, another word for adults, are still in charge in the classroom. But it's the kids or children who run.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: Anyway, I think it's time to reveal the answer to your question. Yes, we just heard that kids go to the bamboo school for free, but do something in return. But what? Georgie guessed it was learning English, which was
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: the wrong answer, I'm afraid. In fact, pupils at the school have to plant trees, 400 of them every year. Right, let's recap the vocabulary we've learned from this programme about a school where the kids or children call the shots. A phrase meaning have the power to make the important decisions.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: The phrase real world is used to describe how the world really is, rather than someone's idea of it, which may be unrealistic or untypical. And finally, community service is work that is done without pay to help people in a community. Once again, our six minutes are up, but remember to join us again next time
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The school that puts the kids in charge.json

chunks.chunk_text: for more trending topics and useful vocabulary here at Six Minute English. Goodbye for now. Bye.
